info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Berkshire, northeastern Columbia and northeastern Greene Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kinderhook, or 7 miles west of Chatham, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Chatham, Lenox, New Baltimore, Coxsackie, Valatie, Austerlitz, Kinderhook, Housatonic, Ghent, Stockport, Stuyvesant, Stockbridge, Canaan, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Barkerville, Rossman, Glendale and Otter Hook. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
